As part of our vibrant and proud extended family, you sustain and strengthen Brown's distinctive brand of academic excellence and enhance educational opportunity for all students through your generosity.

Parent & Family Giving
As part of our vibrant and proud extended family, you sustain and strengthen Brown's distinctive brand of academic excellence and enhance educational opportunity for all students through your generosity.








Building a Future Together

When your student enters Brown, a new world—one that you, your student, and Brown build together—comes alive. This shared journey into excellence and educational opportunity becomes even more meaningful for some families when they give through the parent and family giving program. In fact, Brown’s tradition of parental support—which accounts for nearly 20% of the total philanthropy to the University each year—is the most robust in the Ivy League.

When it comes to giving, engaged parents and families have several choices: 

The Parents Fund. An annual giving fund that allows Brown to maintain and expand the unparalleled educational opportunities and resources that ensure the success of our students.
Programmatic support. Current-use funds in many priorities that offer families a choice to expand their giving in areas where their students are engaged. 
Capstone commitments. Multi-year commitments to targeted areas within the University that may coincide with a students’ emerging academic, research, or extracurricular passions; or to priorities that align with existing family philanthropy. 
Planned giving. A gift that includes the University in the family’s estate planning.












 
In addition, some families involve students in their giving decisions and establish a meaningful tradition of shared family giving to Brown. Students may choose to join the Student Philanthropy Council, the Senior Class Gift Committee, or the Brown Annual Fund Young Leadership Council.
And families whose total annual support to the University exceeds $15,000 are eligible to join a special giving society: Brown Family Fellows. 
Your family’s gift—whatever the size—will make an immediate difference for your child and their classmates. Your support can be felt everywhere. It's in the books that feed their quest for knowledge. It's in the classes that transform how they think. And, it's in the experience they will cherish for a lifetime.
Brown wouldn't be where we are without the generosity and support of our families. Together, you've made our parent and family giving program one of the best in the country — and are a constant source of our community's strength and resilience.
 






“  When we welcome a new student to Brown, we are welcoming the family as well. Parents are deeply valued members of this community, and we encourage their active participation and involvement in the life of the University. 
”


  President Christina H. Paxson
 







Brown prepares its students to forge their own paths.
We invite you to journey alongside them.
For more information, contact:
Laura B. Smith ’06
Director of Parent and Family Givinglaura_beth_smith@brown.edu

 News from Brown

College Day at Brown welcomes local high schoolers to explore University life





April 6, 2023
  Nearly 350 high schoolers from Providence, Central Falls and Pawtucket explored Brown’s multitude of classes, athletic programs and community engagement opportunities, inspiring them to factor college into their plans. 


Read Article

















Open details for College Day at Brown welcomes local high schoolers to explore University life


























 News from Brown

Brown joins national network to strengthen college access for small-town and rural students





April 4, 2023
  Sixteen schools have partnered to form the STARS College Network, a new effort to help students from small-town and rural backgrounds enroll in and graduate from the undergraduate program of their choice. 


Read Article

















Open details for Brown joins national network to strengthen college access for small-town and rural students


























 News from Brown

Brown admits 1,730 students to the undergraduate Class of 2027





March 30, 2023
  The University offered admission on Thursday, March 30, to prospective members of next year’s incoming class, who were selected from Brown’s largest applicant pool to date.


Read Article

















Open details for Brown admits 1,730 students to the undergraduate Class of 2027
